headline: Republicans Open to Witnesses, but Not Enough for the Democrats
abstract: Senators Susan Collins, Lisa Murkowski and Mitt Romney seem open to witnesses in President Trump’s impeachment trial. With one more Republican, Democrats could commandeer the proceedings.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Capitol math is clear: Democrats need only four Republican votes to force the Senate to subpoena witnesses like John R. Bolton, the former White House national security adviser, to testify in President Trump’s impeachment trial. Three have signaled they may be open to doing so: Senators Mitt Romney, Susan Collins and Lisa Murkowski.
keywords: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry
